questions.text: Universal publicly funded healthcare (a National Health Insurance) should be established to provide free basic care to everyone.
Higher education should be free for all students (even if it requires higher taxes or borrowing).
The state should implement an unconditional basic income grant for all citizens, even if it requires higher taxes or borrowing.
Government should invest heavily in public housing construction to alleviate homelessness.
Public housing investment should take priority even if it means less investment in private housing development.
The government should raise taxes on the wealthy to fund social programs and public services.
South Africa should prioritise trade agreements that protect local industries, even if it means higher prices for consumers.
Private property and small-business rights should be strongly protected against expropriation and heavy regulation.
The government should create large public works programs to reduce unemployment, even if it means borrowing more money.
Workers should have stronger rights to strike and protest for better conditions.
Black Economic Empowerment (BEE) and affirmative action should remain central government policies.
Expropriation of private land without market-rate compensation should be permitted under law to accelerate land reform.
Rural development and agricultural support (including food gardens) should be a major focus of government policy.
The country should prioritise investment in renewable energy and climate change adaptation.
Government must urgently invest in fixing water and electricity infrastructure.
The Constitution should be amended where necessary to allow economic growth.
Strong action against corruption (even if it disrupts some government functions) is a priority.
The independence of the judiciary and prosecuting authorities is vital for a healthy democracy.
South Africa needs stronger state capture reforms, even if it means upsetting some officials.
Provinces and municipalities should have more power (and money) to make decisions.
To reduce crime, the government should focus more on harsher punishment rather than addressing social causes like poverty.
Illegal immigrants should be deported and strict border controls enforced to protect jobs.
The government should strengthen legal protections against discrimination (e.g., on race, gender, sexual orientation).
Religious values and teachings should have a great influence on political decisions.
South Africa should formally recognise and fund traditional leadership structures.
Government should provide more funding and support for minority languages and cultural programmes.
South Africa should prioritise broad multilateral diplomacy and cooperation over aligning with any specific geopolitical bloc.
The government should expand surveillance and data collection to improve security and public safety.
Abortion should be legal, publicly funded where necessary, and available on request.
The state should prioritise keeping key public utilities (power, water, rail) in public ownership rather than selling them to private firms.
The government should actively fund and protect Afrikaans language education and cultural programmes.
Government should make active legal and practical accommodations for religious minorities, including Muslim practices and holidays.
The government should introduce specific legal protections and targeted support to preserve the rights and cultures of national minorities.
The government should prioritise paying down public debt and ensuring fiscal sustainability even if it limits new social spending.
Immigration policy should be significantly tightened including stronger border controls and stricter vetting.
